judges: Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
The former Mr. Chief Justice Bell and the former Mr. Justice Babbieri took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Curiam,
Judgment affirmed.
The former Mr. Chief Justice Bell and the former Mr. Justice Babbieri took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Pee Curiam,

attorneys: William J. Brady, Jr., for appellant.

James Garrett, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Oratvford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Howell, Appellant.
Argued November 16, 1971.
Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
William J. Brady, Jr., for appellant.
James Garrett, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Oratvford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
April 20, 1972:
